data.title: Latest update get hang on startup, I'm unble to use it.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. VS code get hang on startup.

I've Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. It works fine.

My Extension List.
- C/C++ 0.12.0 (Microsoft)
- Cordova Tools 1.2.7 (Visual Studio Mobile Tools)
- Java Debugger 0.1.2 (Don Jayamanne)
- Odoo Snippets 0.3.8 (jeffery)
- Python 0.6.7 (Don Jayamanne)
- vscode-icons 7.10.1 (Roberto Huertas)

data.title: Tasks: gulp tasks are not being loaded after update to 1.14
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14
- OS Version: Windows 10

After updating to VSCode 1.14 yesterday. Gulp tasks are not being loaded.

I got this error on output 
`Auto detecting gulp failed with error: Error: Command failed: node_modules\.bin\gulp.cmd --tasks-simple --no-color`

So I have gone to root directory of my project and hit `gulp --tasks-simple`. I got this error

```
[10:32:52] Task never defined: default
[10:32:52] To list available tasks, try running: gulp --tasks

```
But, hitting `gulp --tasks`, tasks are being listed. 

It was working fine before the update. Is something there I am missing

Thanks

data.title: Unable to Sync with Git repo after latest update

3. Not asking for any authentication.
4. Working properly from shell.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.body: Please add option to remove top bar in Zen mode. Atom & Webstorm have a clear screen in Zen mode without any distraction on top.

data.title: askpass.sh not executable
data.body:
After the update to 1.14.0 the file: 
`/opt/visual-studio-code/resources/app/extensions/git/out/askpass.sh` is not marked as executable and therefore when trying to sync a git repository it fails. Had to manually change permissions to fix. I am using Arch Linux.

data.title: Add support for git commit verbose

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When I make a commit, I enjoy writing the commit message in an editor window containing a complete diff of my staged changes. I can do that from the terminal by running the command:

```
git commit --verbose
```

However, VSCode doesn't seem to support that commit mode out of the box. Perhaps it could be the fallback behavior if you run one of the `Git: Commit` commands and enter a blank commit message. (Currently, that fails silently.) Or better yet, how about a `git.verboseCommit` setting that, set to `true`, would make the `Git: Commit` commands take me directly to the verbose commit editor?

2. then, check the code highlight.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->

these not occurrence on `1.13.1`

data.title: Problem Matcher dynamic fileLocation setting
data.body:
I have the following output from my build:

make[1]: Entering directory '/vagrant/nuttx/sched'
make[1]: 'libsched.a' is up to date.
make[1]: Leaving directory '/vagrant/nuttx/sched'
make[1]: Entering directory '/vagrant/nuttx/drivers'
CC:  wireless/ieee802154/mrf24j40/mrf24j40_regops.c
wireless/ieee802154/mrf24j40/mrf24j40_regops.c: In function 'mrf24j40_getreg':
wireless/ieee802154/mrf24j40/mrf24j40_regops.c:130:2: error: 'dev' undeclared (first use in this function)

The issue is that the path needs to be /nuttx/drivers/wireless/ieee802154/mrf24j40/mrf24j40_regops.c

As you can see, that means when the "Entering directory" line is printed, I need to somehow change the path mapping so that the path on the line with the error/warning is linked.

I realize I could fix it for this one case using the fileLocation setting, but that won't work if it's any of the other directories in the project.  Regex could solve it if there were some clever way of combining them.

I am hoping someone here has a clever solution in mind for this, or if maybe there is an easy-enough workaround.  I'd be awesome to be able to get the problem matcher working with this setup!

data.title: Folding is susceptible to indentation
Support "window.titleBarStyle": "custom-inset" setting
data.body:
Electron supports another titlebar style called `hiddenInset` ([more about it)](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/api/frameless-window.md#hiddeninset).

We currently use the `hidden` style when setting `"window.titleBarStyle": "custom"`, therefor I think we should map `"window.titleBarStyle": "custom-inset"` to `hiddenInset`.

The only use case I can think for this is that it enables to hack the interface into those mockups seen in #12377 (notice the semaphore perfectly lined up with the tabs) without needing to patch vsc itself, just with some CSS using [this extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=be5invis.vscode-custom-css).

It should be trivial enough to implement, if you want I can help with that.

data.title: Annoying "[Unsupported]" suffix in the titlebar
data.body:
The "[Unsupported]" suffix in the titlebar is pretty annoying.

In my case it's there because I use the [Custom CSS and JS Loader](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=be5invis.vscode-custom-css) extension, just for removing some stuff I don't use via CSS.

I understand why it's there, but I'd like to have a way to remove it.

Perhaps a `window.titleShowUnsupported` setting?
Perhaps add it via a `${unsupported}` placeholder under the `window.title` setting?

data.title: Missing setting for adding a border below the titlebar
data.body:
There are settings under `workbench.colorCustomizations` for adding a border between all the main parts of the editor, except for the titlebar.

I think there should be a `titleBar.border` setting for this, depending on the color scheme one uses it will look pretty ugly without a it.

Of course this only applies for `"window.titleBarStyle": "native"`.

data.title: CSS: broken comment/uncomment action
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14
- OS Version: macOS 10.13 Beta 1

Steps to Reproduce (bug#1):

1. Open a new editor
2. Set the language to CSS
3. Create a comment (cmd+/)
4. The cursor doesn't get inserted in the middle (`/*|  */` instead of (`/* | */`)

Steps to Reproduce (bug#2):

1. Open a new editor
2. Set the language to CSS
3. Write `.foo {}`
4. Comment/uncomment the line (cmd+/) multiple times, extra spaces get added at the beginning of the line

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: New tasks don't work in WSL

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40, 2017-07-10T18:36:31.751Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: the listing length exceeds browsers' URL characters limit
---

It seems that when using the Bash on Windows as the VSC's shell, commands ran through tasks act as if they received no arguments (npm showing just the default help, etc.).

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have `"terminal.external.windowsExec": "C:\\Windows\\sysnative\\bash.exe",  "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Windows\\sysnative\\bash.exe"` in your settings
2. Open empty folder
3. `Tasks -> Configure Tasks -> Others` (this will add the default `echo Hello` task)
4. Run the `echo` task, which will **not** actually echo "Hello"
5. Editing the task command to `echo Hello > test.txt` and running the task will create the `test.txt` file, but the file will contain just two newlines

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: After "disable all extensions" and clicking reload, all extensions vanish until Code is restarted
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to the extensions panel
2. Disable all extensions from the `...` menu
3. Click one of the "reload" buttons

Extensions are all gone and cannot be re-enabled without restarting VSCode.

data.title: Problem matchers can't match correctlly if output line is longer than width of Integrated Terminal
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: Windows7 and 8.1
- Extensions: C/C++ 0.12.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Narrow down the width of Integrated Terminal.
2. Run build task with problem matchers.

VSCode 1.14.0 with tasks.json 2.0.0 executes tasks in Integrated Terminal and compiler's outputs are wrapped to match with terminal width. This causes issue on problem matchers.

Here is example.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30130109/28141491-9f9a5974-6711-11e7-8c24-953938a7efe1.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30130109/28141497-a72e140a-6711-11e7-9245-f2e425f70e60.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30130109/28141504-ae865866-6711-11e7-9963-ba5939df0448.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30130109/28141507-b2055e2e-6711-11e7-8271-8ff855616e28.png)


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

1. Drag a file in the sidebar from one folder to another
2. Drop. Nothing happens.

data.title: PHP regex syntax coloring breaks on empty square brackets
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40, 2017-07-10T18:36:31.751Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: the listing length exceeds browsers' URL characters limit
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a php file
2. Type somewhere: "/[]/"

Here's a GIF for a better idea:
![php-regex](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4302588/28140049-63e542ce-675f-11e7-8653-2c8b92f4a844.gif)

data.title: PHP auto indent when pressing tab on new line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40, 2017-07-10T18:36:31.751Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: the listing length exceeds browsers' URL characters limit
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to a nested block of code and press enter a couple of times
2. Go to the above line that is empty and press TAB
It doesn't auto add the necessary indentation anymore, for the current nesting.

I have made 2 GIFS to demonstrate this, by comparing behavior from VSCode version 1.13 with VSCode version 1.14.
Also, this seems to be reproducible only in PHP, In Javascript it works as expected.
Indent character is also not important, as I have tested with both tabs and spaces.
As a side-note, I need to mention that once you get used with the editor auto adding necessary indentation, it's very difficult and very annoying adjusting otherwise, until this is fixed :(

**VSCode v1.14**
![php-indent-bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4302588/28139649-b4fb1fdc-675d-11e7-9a55-d9d3ec054af1.gif)

**VSCode v1.13**
![php-indent-good](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4302588/28139704-e1fc0e24-675d-11e7-9acf-f04b46075ccc.gif)


Reproduces without extensions: **Yes**

data.title: Cannot disable extensions when launching with --disable-extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0
- OS Version: All

With the recent issue of the Ruby snippets extension triggering an endless loop in the snippet code it would have been helpful if users could start with `--disable-extensions` and then permanently disable individual extensions through the extensions viewlet.

The Disable actions do not seem to work when launched with `--disable-extensions`, uninstalling extensions was the only option to try and find the extension triggering the problem.

data.title: Auto import for React components (Feature request).
data.body:
Would be nice if you can add feature of "Auto import for React components".
When I type component name in JSX, then VS Code should be able to allow me to auto import the component. 

Web storm does it:  https://blog.jetbrains.com/webstorm/2017/02/webstorm-2017-1-eap-171-3566/
(top of the article).
 ![auto-import-react](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26545183/28138866-4d97a6ca-6763-11e7-89af-0d4cce642918.gif)
